message_1:
Suppose a group of individuals has been diagnosed with a certain type of cancer. The survival times (in months) after diagnosis for a random sample of 12 patients are as follows: 10, 12, 13, 15, 20, 22, 23, 25, 31, 35, 40, 45. 

Find the median survival time for these patients using the Kaplan-Meier survival estimate.
message_2:
To find the median survival time using the Kaplan-Meier survival estimate, we first need to calculate the survival probabilities at each time point. We will assume that there are no censored observations (i.e., all patients have either died or reached the end of the study).

The Kaplan-Meier survival estimate is calculated as follows:

S(t) = (number of patients surviving beyond time t) / (number of patients at risk at time t)

Here are the survival probabilities at each time point:

Time (t) | Number at risk | Number of deaths | Survival probability
--------------------------------------------------------------
10       | 12             | 1                | 11/12
12       | 11             | 1                | 10/11
13       | 10             | 1                | 9/10
15       | 9              | 1                | 8/9
20       | 8              | 1                | 7/8
22       | 7              | 1                | 6/7
23       | 6              | 1                | 5/6
25       | 5              | 1                | 4/5
31       | 4              | 1                | 3/4
35       | 3              | 1                | 2/3
40       | 2              | 1                | 1/2
45       | 1              | 1                | 0/1

Now, we need to find the product of the survival probabilities up to each time point:

Time (t) | Cumulative survival probability
------------------------------------------
10       | (11/12)
12       | (11/12) * (10/11)
13       | (11/12) * (10/11) * (9/10)
15       | (11/12) * (10/11) * (9/10) * (8/9)
20       | (11/12) * (10/11) * (9/10) * (8/9) * (7/8)
22       | (11/12) * (10/11) * (9/10) * (8/9) * (7/8) * (6/7)
23       | (11/12) * (10/11) * (9/10) * (8/9) * (7/8) * (6/7) * (5/6)
25       | (11/12) * (10/11) * (9/10) * (8/9) * (7/8) * (6/7) * (5/6) * (4/5)
31       | (11/12) * (10/11) * (9/10) * (8/9) * (7/8) * (6/7) * (5/6) * (4/5) * (3/4)
35       | (11/12) * (10/11) * (9/10) * (8/9) * (7/8) * (6/7) * (5/6) * (4/5) * (3/4) * (2/3)
40       | (11/12) * (10/11) * (9/10) * (8/9) * (7/8) * (6/7) * (5/6) * (4/5) * (3/4) * (2/3) * (1/2)

The median survival time is the time at which the cumulative survival probability is equal to or just below 0.5. In this case, the median survival time is 40 months, as the cumulative survival probability at 40 months is 0.5.
